title.narrative: INCLUSIVE EVIDENCE-BASED SOCIAL POLICIES, PROGRAMMING AND BUDGETING FOR CHILDREN

description.narrative: Output 4.1: Government and partners at national and decentralized levels have increased capacity to advocate for and strengthen inclusive evidence-based social policies, legislation, programming and budgeting for children, adolescents and women,which contributes to Adolescent Empowerment, Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Social Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 401: By 2023, children and adolescents, especially the poorest and most vulnerable, benefit from increasingly equitable and gender- responsive social policies at national and sub-national levels

mailing-address.narrative: Lhaki Lham 1-11 P.O. Box 239 Thimphu Bhutan

sector.narrative: Contributing to policies reducing child poverty: Poverty reduction strategies, national development plans, engagement with ministries, parliament, international donor and financial organizations, civil society organizations)
National social protection strategies: Policies, strategies, legislation and coordination (inter-ministerial, donor)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 4.1: Government and partners at national and decentralized levels have increased capacity to advocate for and strengthen inclusive evidence-based social policies, legislation, programming and budgeting for children, adolescents and women

description.narrative: In 2020 UNICEF CO further advances the discussions with the government on strengthening awareness and knowledge on Public Finance for Children, social protection and child friendly local governance (CFLG). This is being facilitated through the development of investment case on WASH, policy brief on child-sensitive cash transfer, sensitization of the local government authorities on CFLG and continuation of the Social Policy Certificate Course for the local government officials in partnership with Sherubtse College. The revision of the National Youth Policy is underway in consultation with young people and stakeholders from relevant sectors. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:28/08/2020

title.narrative: 2.1 Evidence: Existence of data and evidence on how social protection systems are responding to child poverty and deprivations (such as health, education, nutrition etc...)

baseline.value: 0 - No information in these areas exists within the past five years

target.value: 2023:2 - There has been both an overall system assessment of the social protection system, including an explicit focus on how it is responding to child poverty and system gaps

actual.value: 2020:1 - There has been a partial assessment of part of the social protection system (such as evaluation of a major programme) including a focus on child outcomes in the past 5 years

title.narrative: Local governments (incl. municipalities) with development plans that include specific activities that address child priorities
1.4 Policies and programmes are influenced by analysis and advocacy to reduce child poverty

baseline.value: 1/Initiating - Child poverty analysis/advocacy not yet influenced discussions/activities to introduce/improve/scale-up policies/programmes to reduce child poverty

target.value: 2023:3/Advanced - Policies/programmes introduced/improved/scaled up to reduce child poverty as a result of child poverty analysis/advocacy

actual.value: 2020:1/Initiating - Child poverty analysis/advocacy not yet influenced discussions/activities to introduce/improve/scale-up policies/programmes to reduce child poverty

title.narrative: Coordination: Coordination mechanisms for social protection systems established countrywide

baseline.value: Level 1- System is fragmented with no functioning formal social protection coordination mechanisms at central or local levels

target.value: 2023:Level 3 - Social protection coordination mechanism is established and functioning at both central and local levels with clear mandates, responsibilities and operating modalities

title.narrative: Communication platforms or networks supported by UNICEF meet quality standards for children and adolescent engagement and participation across development priorities

baseline.value: Level1/25% - Initial efforts on platforms for engagement

actual.value: 2020:Level1/25% - Intermediate quality of platforms for engagement

title.narrative: National decentralization legal and policy framework reflects equity and child rights considerations

actual.value: 2020:Although the Government is currently drafting a national decentralization policy, equity and child right issues have not been reflected in the draft policy.
